title: Authors and Citation
text: Alex Slavenko. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Slavenko (2023). EndosymbiontModel: Run simulations using AGPIP Endosymbiont Model. R package version 0.0.1, https://cesaraustralia.github.io/EndosymbiontModel/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {EndosymbiontModel: Run simulations using the AGPIP Endosymbiont Model},   author = {Alex Slavenko},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 0.0.1},   url = {https://cesaraustralia.github.io/EndosymbiontModel/}, }

title: Run simulations using the AGPIP Endosymbiont Model
text: EndosymbiontModel can installed running following code: details TBA

title: GPA species information — GPA
text: species object defining life history function green peach aphid (Myzus persicae). Can used run endosymbiont model GPA.f_growth fitted using fit_custom data Whalon & Smilowitz 1979.f_loss fitted using fit_sigmoid data Maling et al. 2008.f_suscept fitted using fit_custom data Thackray et al. 2009.f_inoc fitted using fit_quadratic data Thackray et al. 2009.f_alate fitted using fit_custom data Thackray et al. 2009.

title: GPA species information — GPA
text: object class species; see species.

title: GPA species information — GPA
text: Maling, T., Diggle, .J., Thackray, D.J., Siddique, K.H.M., Jones, R..C., epidemiological model externally sourced vector-borne viruses applied Bean yellow mosaic virus lupin crops Mediterranean-type environment. Phytopathology, 98, 1280–1290 (2008) Thackray, D.J., Diggle, .J., Jones, R..C., BYDV PREDICTOR: simulation model predict aphid arrival, episdemics Barley yellow dwarf virus yield loss wheat crops Mediterranean-type environment. Plant Pathology, 58, 186–202 (2009)] Whalon, M.E., Smilowitz, Z., Temperature-dependent model predicting field populations green peach aphid, Myzus persicae. Canadian Entomoligst, 111, 1025–1032 (1979)

title: Area between thresholds — auc_thresh
text: Calculate area curve thresholds y values

title: Area between thresholds — auc_thresh
text: x numeric vector x values y numeric vector y values min_val lower threshold y max_val upper threshold y

title: Area between thresholds — auc_thresh
text: vector consisting two arguments: full area curve, area curve threshold values

title: Area between thresholds — auc_thresh
text: function uses smooth splines fit curve defined vectors x y values. integrates across curve find area curve, two threshold values y.

title: Check species object — check_species
text: Checks validity species object

title: Check species object — check_species
text: object object class species; see species

title: Fit Brière curve — fit_briere
text: Fits curve using Brière model fitting thermal performance curves

title: Fit Brière curve — fit_briere
text: ymax maximal value y xopt value x y = ymax xmin minimal threshold x (y = 0) xmax maximal threshold x (y = 0)

title: Fit Brière curve — fit_briere
text: function accepts x returns y based fitted model

title: Fit Brière curve — fit_briere
text: Fits curve using Brière model (Brière et al. 1999): $$   y = \cdot x \cdot (x - x_{\text{min}}) \cdot ((x_{\text{max}} - x)^{\frac{1}{b}}) $$ Optimal values (scale parameter) b (shape parameter) estimated based provided arguments.

title: Fit Brière curve — fit_briere
text: Brière, J.F., Pracros, P., Le Roux, .Y., Pierre, J.S., novel rate model temperature-dependent development arthropods. Environmental Entomololgy, 28, 22–29 (1999)

title: Fit Brière curve — fit_briere
code: my_func <- EndosymbiontModel:::fit_briere(0.16, 22.61, 4, 30) plot(seq(0, 50, by = 0.1), my_func(seq(0, 50, by = 0.1)), type = "l")

title: Fit custom curve — fit_custom
text: Fits curve using generalised additive model

title: Fit custom curve — fit_custom
text: x vector numeric predictor variable y vector numeric response variable, length x k passed onto smooth term x. Default length(x) - 1

title: Fit custom curve — fit_custom
text: function accepts x returns y based fitted model

title: Fit custom curve — fit_custom
text: Fits generalised additive model (GAM) using mgcv package.

title: Fit Gaussian curve — fit_gaussian
text: Fits curve using Gaussian model fitting thermal performance curves

title: Fit Gaussian curve — fit_gaussian
text: ymax maximal value y xopt value x y = ymax xmin minimal threshold x (y = 0) xmax maximal threshold x (y = 0)

title: Fit Gaussian curve — fit_gaussian
text: function accepts x returns y based fitted model

title: Fit Gaussian curve — fit_gaussian
text: Fits curve using Gaussian model: $$   y = y_{\text{max}} \cdot e^{-0.5 \cdot \left(\frac{{|x - x_{\text{opt}}|}}{{}}\right)^2} $$ Optimal value estimated based provided arguments.

title: Fit Gaussian curve — fit_gaussian
code: my_func <- EndosymbiontModel:::fit_gaussian(0.16, 22.61, 4, 30) plot(seq(0, 50, by = 0.1), my_func(seq(0, 50, by = 0.1)), type = "l")

title: Fit quadratic curve — fit_quadratic
text: Fits quadratic thermal performance curve

title: Fit quadratic curve — fit_quadratic
text: ymax maximal value y xopt value x y = ymax xmin minimal threshold x (y = 0) xmax maximal threshold x (y = 0)

title: Fit quadratic curve — fit_quadratic
text: function accepts x returns y based fitted model

title: Fit quadratic curve — fit_quadratic
text: Fits quadratic curve: $$   y = + b \cdot x + c \cdot x^2 $$ Optimal values (parameter defining y x = 0), b, c estimated based provided arguments.

title: Fit quadratic curve — fit_quadratic
code: my_func <- EndosymbiontModel:::fit_quadratic(0.16, 22.61, 4, 30) plot(seq(0, 50, by = 0.1), my_func(seq(0, 50, by = 0.1)), type = "l")

title: Fit Rezende curve — fit_rezende
text: Fits curve using Rezende model fitting thermal performance curves

title: Fit Rezende curve — fit_rezende
text: ymax maximal value y xopt value x y = ymax xmin minimal threshold x (y = 0) xmax maximal threshold x (y = 0)

title: Fit Rezende curve — fit_rezende
text: function accepts x returns y based fitted model

title: Fit Rezende curve — fit_rezende
text: Fits curve using Rezende model (Rezende et al. 2019): $$   y = \begin{cases}   \cdot 10^{\frac{\log_{10}(q_{10})}{\frac{10}{x}}}, & \text{} x < x_{\text{opt}} \\   \cdot 10^{\frac{\log_{10}(q_{10})}{\frac{10}{x}}} \cdot (1 - b \cdot (x_{\text{opt}} - x)^2), & \text{otherwise}   \end{cases} $$ Optimal values (rate shift parameter), b (decline rate parameter), q_10 estimated based provided arguments.

title: Fit Rezende curve — fit_rezende
text: Rezende, Enrico L., Francisco Bozinovic. Thermal performance across levels biological organization. Philosophical Transactions Royal Society B 374.1778 (2019): 20180549.

title: Fit Rezende curve — fit_rezende
code: my_func <- EndosymbiontModel:::fit_rezende(0.16, 22.61, 4, 30) plot(seq(0, 50, by = 0.1), my_func(seq(0, 50, by = 0.1)), type = "l")

title: Fit sigmoid curve — fit_sigmoid
text: Fits sigmoid curve

title: Fit sigmoid curve — fit_sigmoid
text: ymax maximal value y xmin minimal threshold x (y = 0) xmax maximal threshold x (y = ymax)

title: Fit sigmoid curve — fit_sigmoid
text: function accepts x returns y based fitted model

title: Fit sigmoid curve — fit_sigmoid
text: Fits sigmoid curve: $$   y = \frac{}{1 + e^{-b \cdot (x - x_{\text{max}})}} $$ Optimal values b (curve breadth parameter) estimated based provided arguments.

title: Fit sigmoid curve — fit_sigmoid
code: my_func <- EndosymbiontModel:::fit_sigmoid(0.55, 1.5, 3.5) plot(seq(0, 10, by = 0.1), my_func(seq(0, 10, by = 0.1)), type = "l")

title: Fit thermal performance curve — fit_tpc
text: Fits thermal performance curve using selected model

title: Fit thermal performance curve — fit_tpc
text: model one "briere", "custom", "gaussian", "quadratic", "rezende", "weibull" ... additional arguments selected model

title: Fit thermal performance curve — fit_tpc
text: function accepts x returns y based fitted model

title: Fit thermal performance curve — fit_tpc
text: Fits curve using selected model. "custom" requires vectors x y values. models requires values ymax, xopt, xmin, xmax optimises parameters selected model based input arguments.

title: Fit Weibull curve — fit_weibull
text: Fits curve using Weibull model fitting thermal performance curves

title: Fit Weibull curve — fit_weibull
text: ymax maximal value y xopt value x y = ymax xmin minimal threshold x (y = 0) xmax maximal threshold x (y = 0)

title: Fit Weibull curve — fit_weibull
text: function accepts x returns y based fitted model

title: Fit Weibull curve — fit_weibull
text: Fits curve using Weibull model: $$   y = \cdot \left(\frac{c - 1}{c}\right)^{\frac{1 - c}{c}} \cdot \left(\frac{x - x_{\text{opt}}}{b} + \left(\frac{c - 1}{c}\right)^{\frac{1}{c}}\right)^{c - 1}  \cdot e^{-\left(\left(\frac{x - x_{\text{opt}}}{b} + \frac{c - 1}{c}\right)^{\frac{1}{c}}\right)^c + \frac{c - 1}{c}\right)}  $$ Optimal values (curve height parameter), b (curve breadth parameter), c (curve shape parameter) estimated based provided arguments.

title: Fit Weibull curve — fit_weibull
code: my_func <- EndosymbiontModel:::fit_weibull(0.16, 22.61, 4, 30) plot(seq(0, 50, by = 0.1), my_func(seq(0, 50, by = 0.1)), type = "l")

what: An S4 class to store a species' life history and functions for the endosymbiont model — species-class
title: An S4 class to store a species' life history and functions for the endosymbiont model — species-class
text: S4 class store species' life history functions endosymbiont model

title: An S4 class to store a species' life history and functions for the endosymbiont model — species-class
text: name name species reproduction form reproduction species ("sexual", "asexual") development form development species ("holometabolous", "hemimetabolous) f_growth Function growth rate ~ temperature f_loss Function mortality rate ~ rainfall f_suscept Function infection susceptability ~ temperature f_inoc Function inoculation efficiency ~ temperature f_alate Function production alates ~ proportion carrying capacity (density)

title: An S4 class to store a species' life history and functions for the endosymbiont model — species-class
code: GPA <- new("species",   name = "Myzus persicae",   reproduction = "asexual",   development = "hemimetabolous",   f_growth = EndosymbiontModel:::fit_tpc("custom",     c(4, 8.87, 11.82, 14.22, 17.13, 19.92, 22.61, 25.77, 27.80, 30),     c(0, 0.06, 0.09, 0.11, 0.13, 0.15, 0.16, 0.14, 0.04, 0)),   f_loss = EndosymbiontModel:::fit_sigmoid(0.55, 1.5, 3.5),   f_suscept = EndosymbiontModel:::fit_tpc("custom",     seq(0, 40, 4)[1:10],     c(0, 0.15, 0.3, 0.45, 0.6, 0.75, 0.75, 0.6, 0.3, 0)),  f_inoc = EndosymbiontModel:::fit_tpc("quadratic", 0.8, 22, 0, 40),  f_alate = EndosymbiontModel:::fit_tpc("custom",   seq(0, 1, 0.1),   c(0.01, 0.22, 0.35, 0.45, 0.53, 0.6, 0.66, 0.72, 0.76, 0.78, 0.79))  )  GPA #> An object of class "species" #> Slot "name": #> [1] "Myzus persicae" #>  #> Slot "reproduction": #> [1] "asexual" #>  #> Slot "development": #> [1] "hemimetabolous" #>  #> Slot "f_growth": #> function (x)  #> { #>     new <- data.frame(x = x) #>     y <- as.numeric(unlist(mgcv::predict.gam(mod, newdata = new))) #>     y <- ifelse(y < 0, 0, y) #>     return(y) #> } #> <bytecode: 0x5642435337e8> #> <environment: 0x564243e958a0> #>  #> Slot "f_loss": #> function (x)  #> { #>     y <- ymax/(1 + exp(-a * (x - xmax))) #>     return(y) #> } #> <bytecode: 0x56423afe0780> #> <environment: 0x564244033728> #>  #> Slot "f_suscept": #> function (x)  #> { #>     new <- data.frame(x = x) #>     y <- as.numeric(unlist(mgcv::predict.gam(mod, newdata = new))) #>     y <- ifelse(y < 0, 0, y) #>     return(y) #> } #> <bytecode: 0x5642435337e8> #> <environment: 0x564244044858> #>  #> Slot "f_inoc": #> function (x)  #> { #>     y <- a + b * x + c * x^2 #>     y <- ifelse(x < xmin | x > xmax, 0, ifelse(y < 0, 0, y)) #>     return(y) #> } #> <bytecode: 0x56423f1dc658> #> <environment: 0x5642442075b8> #>  #> Slot "f_alate": #> function (x)  #> { #>     new <- data.frame(x = x) #>     y <- as.numeric(unlist(mgcv::predict.gam(mod, newdata = new))) #>     y <- ifelse(y < 0, 0, y) #>     return(y) #> } #> <bytecode: 0x5642435337e8> #> <environment: 0x5642442555f0> #>
